data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Steps backward are the same as steps forward. Steps left are equal to 10 steps forward. Steps forward are equal to 10 steps forward. Steps right are equal to 9 steps right. Steps backward are equal to 10 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn around and back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 4 steps. 6 steps and 4 steps do not return you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left and then return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and take 5 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around and take 7 steps backwards to turn around. This will take you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You can return to the starting point by doing the following steps: Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

When you take one step left, you are returning to the beginning point. When you take four steps forward, you are returning to the beginning point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around after you have taken the 9 steps. Take the remaining 2 steps. Then take 3 steps to make it back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

One can take 1 step forward in the same sequence as they were taken backward. The answer: Yes.

You can always take the correct amount of steps. If you always face forward, you can always return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

First steps away are forward. First steps in reverse order are backward. First steps forward are next to second steps. As for the first sequence, the last sequence is starting with the same starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you will always return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You return to the starting point by facing forward. The correct sequence of steps is always facing forward. If you are facing left, you always begin in the same place as if you were facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right, take 4 steps, turn around and take ten steps. Turn left, take 10 steps, turn around and take four steps. Take 8 steps, turn around and take 4 steps. Take 3 steps, turn around and take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If we take 10 steps and turn around, at this point we still need to take 9 steps. We are then ready to take 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around is one of the last steps. Turning around is one of the first two steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn right, you take 7 steps. If you turn right, you take 2 steps. If you turn right, you take 1 step. If you turn right, you take 3 steps. If you turn right, you take 1 step. If you turn right, you take 3 steps. The first direction is right. The second direction is left. So, the answer is No.

To turn left on a street, you first have to take one step forward at the beginning. Thus, the answer is No.

If you take any other number of steps than 5 and 2 you are still in the starting position. Twice around is to walk around in circles and then return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The first shortest step goes back to the starting point of your current destination in the same direction as were you moving. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 7 more steps to face left and take a total of 7 + 2 + 7 = 12 steps. Taking 8 steps left takes 7 steps backward and 7 steps forward. Take 8 steps left, 7 steps forward and 7 steps right. Again, taking 12 steps backward takes 9 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

You can return anywhere on a map. If you take 5 steps back, you are going into reverse. So, the answer is Yes.

On the following instructions, the starting point is facing forward. Each of the steps backward is 3 steps. Each of the steps forward is 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

In the above examples, the starting point would be the first step one takes. If you take 1 step back, you will be back at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You would turn around to make sure you'd return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

In the first step, you face forward. In the second step, you face backward. In the third step, you face forward. In the fourth step, you face left. In the fifth step, you face right. By following these instructions, you always return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

Take 4 steps backward and take 9 steps ahead. To reverse the order, you take 5 steps backward and take 9 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Once you have gone backward by 1, you cannot go forward by the same amount. If you have gone backward by 3, you must go forward by 3, or you cannot go forward by 3. So, the answer is yes.

If you return to the starting point from any point in the pattern, you have to face forward. There is an alternative process involved, and that is to start from their starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The number of steps takes 18 / 9 = 2 more steps than the starting number. Also, it would take 6 / 3 = 2 steps to go back to the starting place. So, the answer is Yes.

You can take 9 steps left and return to the starting point by going right 7 steps. You cannot take 6 steps right and back at 2nd highest point so you will be facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Whenever you start a new step, you are facing forward. If you take 10 steps backward, you only take 10 steps forward. If you take 8 steps backward, you only take 8 steps forward. If you take 1 step forward, you only take 1 step forward. If you take 7 steps backward, you only take 7 steps backwards. If you take 10 steps forward, you only take 10 steps forward. Similarly, if you take 7 steps right, you only take 7 steps right. So in total, in all ways you return to your starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is normally facing forward. If your facing backwards, there are always 7 steps backward. If you are facing forward, there are 4 steps forward. Taking 7 steps backward means you are facing the wall. Taking 10 steps right results in you being 1 step left on the wall. So, the answer is No.
